title: Camshaft Drive Chain Tensioner - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Crankcase Right Hand Cover - Remove L Series
While you rotate the crankshaft, make sure that the front camshaft drive chain rubbing blade stays in its mounting.
Before you insert the timing pin, make sure the dot on the primary gear is aligned with the line on the crankcase.

Use the bolt that is fitted to the end of the crankshaft to rotate the crankshaft clockwise (the normal direction of rotation). Stop rotation when number 1 cylinder is at Top Dead Centre (TDC), that is when the dot mark on the primary gear aligns with the line on the crankcase.
into the timing holes in the crankcase and crankshaft.
In addition to the dot mark alignment, at TDC, the alignment marks on the camshaft bosses will point inwards.
Place a suitable wedge between the camshaft drive chain tensioner blade and crankcase, to hold the camshaft drive chain taut during removal of the tensioner.

The hydraulic tensioner is under spring tension. Always wear hand, eye, and face protection when withdrawing the tensioner mounting bolts and take great care to minimise the risk of injury and loss of components.
Note the orientation of the hydraulic tensioner.
Evenly release the mounting bolts for the hydraulic tensioner until the plunger spring tension has been released.
Remove the hydraulic tensioner and discard the O-ring and gasket.
